sentence.Network_en: This cookery book have being wrote by a real epicure.
sentence.Network_cn: 这本食谱是由一位真正的美食家写的.

sentence.Network_en: Each nibble was eaten with the air of an epicure.
sentence.Network_cn: 每小块食物都吃得津津有味的样子.

sentence.Network_en: Ogre that he was, he spoke like an epicure.
sentence.Network_cn: 他虽是个吃人恶魔, 说话倒像个美食家.

list.abs: ...美食家或美食主义者（Epicurean, epicure）是指美食评论家|善于品评美食、美酒的专家，俗称为老饕。它也有可能是指：* 享乐主义|享.
...epic poetry 史诗epicentre 震央震源震中中心epicenter epicure 美食者讲究饮食epicurean 丰盛享乐主义者
she grows very fatly , at ordinary times appetite is wonderful , and she others not care a cent gives her the coronal with epicure laurel .她长得很胖，平时胃口极好，而她又毫不在乎别人给她冠以美食家桂冠。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a disciple of Epicurus): via medieval Latin from Greek Epikouros 'Epicurus'

entry.tran: （尤指喜欢吃稀奇食物的）美食家
entry.def: An epicure is someone who enjoys eating food that is of very good quality, especially unusual or rare food.

means.word_mean: 1. a person devoted to refined sensuous enjoyment (especially good food and drink)

auth_sentence.content: The avian epicure thus grabbed both the salad and the sushi courses in one swell swoop.
